column6: Zhejiang Huayou Cobalt Co., Ltd produces and sells cobalt chemicals in China. It also focuses on the nonferrous smelting of cobalt, nickel, and copper. The company's products include cuprous oxide; cobalt tetroxide, oxide, carbonate, hydroxide, oxalate, sulfate, chloride, and monoxide; and nickel protoxide and copper oxide. Its products are used for Li-ion battery cathode material, high temperature and cemented carbide, frits and glazes, rubber adhesive, and petrochemical catalysts. The company was founded in 2002 and is based in Zhejiang, China.
BBOXX is a designer, manufacturer, and distributor of plug and play solar systems to enhance access to energy. The company was established in 2010 and is headquartered in London, UK.
column36: Max Gopfert, managing director, Democratic Republic of Conga, said; "I think the biggest opportunity in Congo is the size of the market. Congo is the fourth largest off-grid market in the world. There's huge potential here; it's one of the only places in the world where you have massive urban centres that are almost lacking in power. Kinshasa, Mbuji-Mayi, Kananga, Goma: these are places that have real economies behind them but they still have little or no power".

column6: Orange provides a range of fixed telephony and mobile telecommunications, data transmission, Internet and multimedia, and other value-added services to consumers, businesses, and other telecommunications operators under the Orange brand worldwide. The company was formerly known as France Telecom and changed its name to Orange in July 2013. The company was founded in 1990 and is based in Paris, France.

Switzerland-based Fracht provides logistics solutions. The company offers air freight and sea freight delivery in addition to rail, barging and trucking services. Founded in 1955, Fracht is headquartered in Basel, Switzerland.
Sakthi Trading Group is a global leader in Gold and diamond-based commodities from conflict-free zones of the West Africa and East Africa. The firm is based in Hong Kong.

column4: Guangdong Silver Age Sci & Tech Co., Ltd
column5: Guangdong Silver Age Sci & Tech Co., Ltd
column6: Guangdong Silver Age Sci & Tech Co., Ltd. engages in the research, development, manufacture, and distribution of various polymer materials in China. The company's principal products include flame retardant, weather resistant, reinforced and toughened, biodegradable, and other high performance materials, as well as plastic alloys and thermoplastic elastomers. Its products are used in electrical and electronics, wires and cables, household appliances, lighting, rail transport, highways, automotive parts, medical equipment, sanitary and bath products, stationery, sports, and other fields. The company was formerly known as Dongguan Silver Age Plastics Co., Ltd and changed its name to Guangdong Silver Age Sci & Tech Co., Ltd. in December 2006. Guangdong Silver Age Sci & Tech Co., Ltd. was founded in 1997 and is headquartered in Dongguan, China.

Dubai World, through its subsidiaries, provides transport and logistics, drydocks and maritime, urban development and investment, and financial services. The company offers international marine terminal operations and development, logistics and related services; maritime services to industry and government sectors; and stevedoring services, such as containers, bulk, general and project cargoes, car carriers, reefer vessels stores, passenger vessel stores, and baggage handling. The company is based in Dubai, United Arab Emirates, and was established in 2006.

Nanjing Hanrui Cobalt Co., Ltd. produces and sells cobalt powder and other cobalt-based powder primarily in China. Its products include cobalt powders, cobaltosic oxide, cobalt carbonate, cobaltous sulfate, cobalt chloride, electrolytic cobalt, and crude cobalt hydroxide. The company also sells its products in South Korea, Japan, Germany, Switzerland, Israel, India, and the United States. Nanjing Hanrui Cobalt Co., Ltd. was founded in 1997 and is headquartered in Nanjing, China.
column38: Nanjing Hanrui Cobalt, Qingyuan Keweike Mineral Trade

column6: Serena Group is a hotel chain that operates in Afghanistan, Kenya, Mozambique, Pakistan, Rwanda, Tanzania, Uganda and Zanzibar. It is one of 96 companies that makes up the Aga Khan Fund for Economic Development (AKFED), the for-profit arm of the Aga Khan Development Network (AKDN).  The Serena Group trades under the name Tourism Promotion Services (TPS Serena). The company is listed on the Nairobi Stock Exchange and owns and manages 15 properties in Africa. Serena Hotels was founded in 1970 and is based in Nairobi, Kenya.
